content: Hello! Thank you for contacting XYZ Home Services. Can I please have your name to get started with your HVAC service request?
Why do you need my name? Can’t you just fix my AC already? It’s hot in here.
I understand it’s frustrating to be without AC! I need your name so I can create your appointment and ensure our technician has the right information. Could you please tell me your name?
It’s Mrs. Harper. Just put that. Now how much is this going to cost me? I don’t want to be charged an arm and a leg for nothing!

Thank you, Mrs. Harper. I understand cost is very important. If you can briefly describe the issue with your AC, I can try to get you a price estimate. Could you also provide your address so we can confirm service availability?
My AC just blows warm air and makes this rattling noise. It’s 204 Maple Lane. Please don’t send anyone who’ll just try to upsell me. If it’s too expensive, I don’t want it.
Thank you for the details, Mrs. Harper. I’ll check if your address is within our service area and get you a price estimate. One moment, please.

Great news: you are in our service area. Based on your description, a diagnostic visit typically costs $89, and if it’s a small repair, costs usually start around $150. We’ll let you know before any work is done. Would you like to schedule a technician to come out? What day and time work best for you?
Ugh, fine. Tomorrow morning. Not too early, though. And if anyone tries to sell me something extra, I’ll send them packing.
Understood, Mrs. Harper. I’ll look for an appointment slot for tomorrow morning, but not too early. Our earliest is 8:00 AM—would a time between 9:00 AM and 11:00 AM work for you?
10 AM. If they’re late, forget it.

You’re confirmed for a 10 AM appointment tomorrow. Our technician will arrive on time and will not try to upsell you. We’ll send you a reminder before arrival. Anything else you’d like to ask or let us know?
reason: Appointment booked for 10 AM as requested.

content: Fine. We’ll see. Don’t let me down.
